summary: The amount of money people spend on prescription drugs has nearly doubled since the 1990s. Much of this increase is due to expensive brand-name drugs, but the prices of some generics have also gone up. We looked into changes in the drug industry and found that pharmaceutical and biotechnology sales revenue increased from $534 billion to $775 billion between 2006 and 2015. Additionally, 67% of...
title: Drug Industry: Profits, Research and Development Spending, and Merger and Acquisition Deals
